bug.short_desc: Add support for more "native" types in API documentation

long_desc.thetext: I would like to have more types in the API documentation and maybe property system (to keep them in-sync) for improved readability of the API. Sure some of them could be described in the documentation of a parameter but it is easier with better, more restrictive types. I would suggest the following new types: * Selector e.g. "h2+h3" * Html e.g. "hello" * StyleProperty e.g. marginTop * StyleSize e.g. "10px" or "1em" or "0" * Fragment e.g. document.createDocumentFragment Maybe it's even possible to document these native types somewhere in the API viewer.
I guess thats something we should first consider changed in the Property system and after that in the API viewer. So I take this bug to me for further review.
I don't think we need that. These types are mostly no native types so it might be confusing to have them linked.
